service1.title: Preventive Care
service1.subtitle: An annual veterinary check-up should be one of your top priorities
service1.subtitle2: Preventive veterinary care is key to maintaining your pet’s health.
service1.para1: Preventive veterinary care is the most effective strategy to ensure the health and wellbeing of your pets, offering them a long and happy life. The aim of prevention is to detect and avoid health problems before they develop into serious conditions that require urgent care — which can be stressful for your pet and costly for you.
service1.para2: Routine veterinary check-ups, timely vaccinations, and regular parasite control are essential to keeping pets healthy and protected. Our region’s climate makes parasite prevention crucial to avoid diseases like leishmaniasis, ehrlichiosis, and heartworm. Vaccination also protects against illnesses such as parvovirus and leptospirosis.

service2.title: Laboratory Tests
service2.subtitle: Essential for diagnosing medical conditions
service2.subtitle2: Blood tests are critical in assessing overall health.
service2.para1: Hematological tests include checking organ function and screening for infectious diseases that are common in our region.
service2.para2: We conduct comprehensive bloodwork, including liver, kidney, and pancreas function, protein and electrolyte levels, as well as serological tests for transmissible diseases in dogs and cats. The specific tests are selected after consultation, based on each pet’s clinical picture and needs.

service3.title: Surgical Procedures
service3.subtitle: Our clinic is equipped with modern surgical equipment
service3.subtitle2: We offer preventive, therapeutic, and diagnostic surgeries.
service3.para1: Each surgical procedure is preceded by a thorough pre-op exam, including bloodwork and ultrasound if needed. Anesthesia is personalized based on the pet’s health status, and vital signs are monitored continuously during surgery.
service3.para2: Post-operative care is clearly explained and tailored to your pet’s recovery. If needed, pets stay at the clinic for observation to ensure they leave safe and stabilized. We’re here to answer any concerns you may have about anesthesia or recovery.

service4.title: Dental Care
service4.subtitle: Regular dental care is essential for your pet's health
service4.para1: We provide professional teeth cleaning, extractions, and treatment for feline stomatitis. Dental issues can increase bacterial load and cause significant pain, greatly reducing your pet’s quality of life.
